buttons.label: Disease Association
buttons.helpText: Disease Associations: Articles are linked to genes based on NCBI's Gene <-> Pubmed associations (human and mouse orthologs). Genes are linked to diseases based on the presence of keywords in the Abstract or MeSH Terms of Pubmed entries. Click to see the list of Abstract and MeSH terms.

legend.text: Articles are linked to genes based on NCBI's Gene <-> Pubmed associations (human and mouse orthologs). Genes are linked to diseases based on the presence of keywords in the Abstract or MeSH Terms of Pubmed entries. Click to see the list of Abstract and MeSH terms.

buttons.label: Non-Silent SNPs
buttons.helpText: Non-Silent SNPs: Natural variations extracted from www.uniprot.org/docs/humsavar.

buttons.label: Orphanet
buttons.helpText: Orphanet

buttons.label: Summary
buttons.helpText: Summary: Swissprot summary of protein function

buttons.label: Substrate
buttons.helpText: Substrate: Published substrate specificity

buttons.label: Domain Architecture
buttons.helpText: Domain Architecture: PFAM domains identified by using HMMER-3.0 on the protein sequences (downloadable from a link at the top of the tree) against the PFAM database, with an Evalue threshold of 0.01

buttons.label: Protein Interactions
buttons.helpText: Protein Interactions: Interaction network from http://www.string-db.org

buttons.label: Human Protein Interactome
buttons.helpText: Protein Interactome: data from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25416956

buttons.label: Subcellular Location
buttons.helpText: Subcellular location: Subcellular location extracted from the Swiss-Prot record of each gene

buttons.label: Pubmed
buttons.helpText: Pubmed: Articles linked to the NCBI's Entrez Gene record of the human, mouse and rat orthologs. Articles linked to 30 or more genes (typically sequencing or microarray data) are ignored.

buttons.label: Funding
buttons.helpText: Funding (Find collaborators): Funded NIH grants with gene name in title or abstract. Data extracted from RePORT.

buttons.label: Inhibitors
buttons.helpText: Inhibitors: Small molecule modulators from the published and patent literature

buttons.label: Ligands in Structures
buttons.helpText: compounds with MW < 1000 Da and at least 6 carbons complexed to target of interest

buttons.label: Structures
buttons.helpText: Structures: Structure coverage generated by blasting the protein sequence (downloadable from a link at the top of the tree) against the PDB with a sequence identity cut-off of 95% and minimum coverage of 30 residues

buttons.label: Antigen Produced
buttons.helpText:
Displayed on the phylogenetic trees the proteins for which we have generated recombinant IgGs and Fabs and that have been validated for one or more application. Also indicated are those proteins for which recombinant IgGs or FAbs will become available in the near future. Please send us a message if you have a particular interest in antibodies to one or more targets and if you are interested in collaborating with us on validating these antibodies.
Antigen: Antigens have been cloned, expressed and purified at SGC for FAb/IgG production.

buttons.label: FAb Produced
buttons.helpText:
Displayed on the phylogenetic trees the proteins for which we have generated recombinant IgGs and Fabs and that have been validated for one or more application. Also indicated are those proteins for which recombinant IgGs or FAbs will become available in the near future. Please send us a message if you have a particular interest in antibodies to one or more targets and if you are interested in collaborating with us on validating these antibodies.
FAb: At least one FAb has been validated at SGC for this antigen.

buttons.label: IgG Produced
buttons.helpText:
Displayed on the phylogenetic trees the proteins for which we have generated recombinant IgGs and Fabs and that have been validated for one or more application. Also indicated are those proteins for which recombinant IgGs or FAbs will become available in the near future. Please send us a message if you have a particular interest in antibodies to one or more targets and if you are interested in collaborating with us on validating these antibodies.
IgG: At least one IgG has been validated at SGC for this antigen.

buttons.label: Expression in Cancer Lines
buttons.helpText: Expression in Cancer Lines: Data extracted from Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia (PMID 22460905) and www.cancerRXgene.org (PMID 22460902).

buttons.label: Gene Fusions in Cancer
buttons.helpText: Gene Fusions in Cancer: Data extracted from the August 18, 2014 version of the Mitelman database.

buttons.label: Known Chromosomal Aberrations in Cancer
buttons.helpText: Data extracted from the November 4th 2014 version of the Cancer Gene Census.

buttons.label: RNASeq Gene Expression
buttons.helpText:
Gene Expression:
Change in gene expression (Log 2) between tumor sample and non-tumor sample from the same patient. RNASeq V2 data extracted from The Cancer Genome Atlas Data Matrix

Click here for method used to calculate fold change values

items.fieldLabel: Show genes with a log2 fold change
items.name: seq_evaluator
patient_seq_cutoff
items.fieldLabel: Exclude cancer types where patients number is <

items.name: seqexp_rank_cutoff

buttons.label: Vulnerability of Cancer Cell Lines to shRNA
buttons.helpText:
shRNA: Data extracted from The Integrative Genomics Portal:
shRNAs were used to probe the essentiality of 11,194 genes in 102 human cancer cell lines [PMID 21746896].

Click here for explanation of default values

items.name: shrna_cutoff
items.fieldLabel: where log2 fold change in shRNA abundance is <=

items.boxLabel: flag genes where no data is available
items.name: shrna_flag

buttons.label: Somatic Mutations in Cancer
buttons.helpText:
Somatic Mutations: Data extracted from International Cancer Genome Consortium and The Cancer Genome Atlas.

MutSigCV was used to determine significantly mutated genes.
MutSigCV data was extracted from GDAC's FireHose's standard data run.
MutSigCV data is not available for somatic mutaions extracted from International Cancer Genome Consortium

Click here for explanation of dynamic cutoff values

items.boxLabel: Only show significant results according to MutSigCV (q <= 0.1)
items.name: structure

items.boxLabel: Use dynamic cutoffs for hypermutated genomes
items.name: structure
patient_cutoff
items.fieldLabel: Exclude cancer types with patients number <

items.name: results_cutoff
items.fieldLabel: Exclude genes mutated in patients number <

buttons.label: Protein Levels in Tumors
buttons.helpText: Protein Levels in Tumors: Staining profiles for proteins in human tumor tissue based on immunohistochemisty using tissue micro arrays. Data from The Human Protein Atlas version 18. Data from The Human Protein Atlas version 18. www.proteinatlas.org and DOI: DOI: 10.1126/science.aan2507
